availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Winchester, Kentucky, banker. Winchester native. Son of Philip B. Winn. Married Mary Jane Brassfield Winn. Father of Eliza S. Winn and Philip B. Winn. Partner with William Winn and James Simpson in the Deposit Bank of Winn, Simpson & Co. in Winchester. Owned three enslaved people in Clark County in 1860.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, Winchester District No. 2, p. 72; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, Winchester, p. 32; Harry B. Enoch, Where in the World?: Historic Places in Clark County, Kentucky (Winchester, Ky.: Bluegrass Heritage Museum, 2007), 139.
